  • Method Details

    • makeMap

      private java.util.HashMap<java.time.LocalDate,​java.lang.Integer> makeMap​(java.time.LocalDate[] dates)
      Generates a HashMap with LocalDate keys and Integer values. the keys are stracted from the input and the values are equal to de index of each date + 1
      Parameters:
      dates - LocalDate array that is goin to be mapped
      Returns:
      ashMap with LocalDate keys obtained from the LocalDate array given as input and Integer values

    • getLocalDate

      public static java.time.LocalDate getLocalDate​(java.lang.String text)
      parses a LocalDate object in the formatt "MM.dd.yyyy"
      Parameters:
      text - date to be parsed into a LocalDate object in the format "MM.dd.yyyy"
      Returns:
      returns a LocalDate object with month, day, year instances of teh given text

    • getLocalDate

      public static java.time.LocalDate[] getLocalDate​(java.lang.String[] array)
      parses a LocalDate array from a String array with text in the formatt "MM.dd.yyyy"
      Parameters:
      array - array of dates to be parsed into a LocalDate array in the format "MM.dd.yyyy"
      Returns:
      returns a LocalDate array with month, day, year instances of teh given text

    • compareYear

      public void compareYear()

    • compareYear

      public static int[] compareYear​(java.time.LocalDate dateOne, java.time.LocalDate dateTwo)
      calculates the amount of time in {years, months, days} that there is from the later date to the earliest date
      Parameters:
      dateOne - LocalDate object to find the ammount of time, it can be the lowest or the highest.
      dateTwo - LocalDate object to find the ammount of time, it can be the lowest or the highest.
      Returns:
      returns an array of lenght 3 in the following form [Years, Months, Days] the values within the array tell the amount of time that there is between the given parameters

    • populateLeapYear

      private java.lang.String[] populateLeapYear​(java.time.LocalDate[] dates)
      populates a String array with information about if the date passed as LocalDate has a year that is leap or not
      Parameters:
      dates - LocalDate array to verify if the year of each of its elements is leap or not
      Returns:
      returns a string array that shows strings at position on index i telling if the LocalDate in index i of the given parameter is leap or not

    • dateHashMap

      public void dateHashMap()
      prints the mapped dates

    • toPrint

      public java.lang.String[] toPrint​(java.util.Map<java.time.LocalDate,​java.lang.Integer> map)
      modifies the given string obtained when the method toString() is called on an map type object. The objective of this emthod is to obtained a printable string that is presented in a vertical form
      Parameters:
      map - Map object to be printed
      Returns:
      returns a String array that is ready to be printed with each string in the format Key:Value

    • dateHashMapSorted

      public void dateHashMapSorted()
      sorts and print the mapped dates
